pros: Solid management, even though it's a big hospital- they care for their people.
cons: Currently none. Love what I've seen with changes in management

pros: Technicians Give great care to patients and work very hard to raise standards. Technicians are taught high standards of care. Cant get that anywhere else.
cons: Management does not show proper appreciation of staff and grossly underpays for what they do.

job_title: Client Patient Coordinator in Houston, TX
pros: Great people and get to help animals in need
cons: Long hours hard to balance work and life

pros: Interesting medical cases, top notch equipment. Easier workload than a GP practice.
cons: DVMs are rude to staff. Management is non-existent. High levels of staff favoritism lead to toxic and negative environment. They are owned by NVA.

pros: great department training, lots of learning
cons: long hours, every one sticks to themselves

job_title: Licensed Veterinary Technician in Houston, TX
pros: made great friends, learned a lot, and somewhat good benefits
cons: you are not paid what you are worth, and when you ask for a raise you get a long excuse of why you haven't gotten one yet. you don't get unpaid time off, you must use PTO for EVERYTHING. barely any days off, on-call every other weekend at this time. so 4 true days off a month at this time. Favoritism for people who have been there a while (5+years).

pros: The growing experience is great
cons: The pay is horrible and the management

review_title: Room  for growth, but unfair  wages
pros: Specialty veterinary medicine, state of the art vet hospital
cons: under paid, over worked, high turnover

pros: Only pro is working with animals. Only giving ones because there is nothing less
cons:
Training on how things work is lacking. Some of these techs just finished school and you hire them as place fillers not giving them the opportunity to
Reach their full potential. Long hours with no breaks at times, both food and bathroom. Lack of support from managers. “Fly by the seat of your pants” mentality. Very poor management. You can repeatedly ask for help and are told you are doing great only to be told you made a mistake a month ago that may cost you your job!

job_title: Shift Lead, Veterinary Technician in Houston, TX
pros: Leading veterinary specialty medicine, amazing board certified veterinary specialists
cons: Lower than average pay, poor support from top management

job_title: Client Patient Coordinator in Houston, TX
pros: Interesting work and great surgeons
cons: Pay is low and you are not valued as an individual

pros: 13 hour shift 3 day a week schedule, very good techs and Drs
cons: Perpetually understaffed, absent management, all about $$$. They'll work you until you die at least in the emergency dept. Terrible turnover

pros: Income til you find another opportunity. Loved the place of employment just disliked how I was treated by my Department.
cons: Very disrespectful coworkers. Pushed all the limits to get my responsibilities done just to be told by a coworker from my department constantly "I don't actually do anything".

review_title: Great individual supervisors but needs work as a whole
pros: A great learning environment for knowledgeable technicians to continue to grow.
cons: Upper management can be very difficult and employees often feel as if they are ignored. Some departments have a lot of drama.

review_title: Great starting pay, continuing education paid for by company
pros: Great starting pay for only having 2 years experience in the field. Great coworkers and having paid holidays, offered medical, PTO, as well as uniform and CE reimbursement.
cons: The people in HR are a bit 'uncaring' during certain situations. You deal with animal waste, vomit, etc.

pros: Good benefits and coworkers, good pay, hours and career outlook
cons: there are no cons if you love what you do

pros: Amazing facility and specialties and staff
cons: Difficult to advance, no support, forced to work horrible hours

job_title: Veterinary Technician, LVT in Houston, TX
pros: Weekends off, somewhat organized, good learning experience
cons: A lot of hours, very stressful

pros:
There have been some major positive internal changes recently that I really feel have greatly benefited ALL departments. I can honestly say that I look forward to coming to work each day. It is very unique that all of these departments: Surgery & Orthopedics, Internal Medicine, Oncology, Critical Care, Dentistry & Oral Surgery, Dermatology & Allergy, Avian & Exotics, Diagnostic Imaging, Ophthalmology, Cardiology, Sports Medicine, Rehabilitation & Fitness, Nutrition and Acupuncture are all under one roof. Patients can be easily transferred between departments if needed, which truly makes in seem like a human hospital. 

Employees also receive a nice benefits package. Great insurance.
cons: This is a very fast-paced work environment and can be high-stress at times. You must be organized and able to multi-task. If you are used to working in a high-energy, fast-paced environment this may be a good fit for you. If not, I would recommend considering other employment opportunities.

pros: The wonderful animals and their "parents"; the potential to improve furry lives.
cons: Too many chiefs (the doctors) with different demands; total inconsistency; lack of communication; cliquish between management, doctors, tech staff, office staff.   Turnover was very high; promises about role advancement were not fulfilled.

review_title: Once a great place to work... now headed in the wrong direction.
pros:
- Access to great medical care for your pets
- Decent starting pay & benefits
cons:
- Poor management. Very little follow through. Employees do not feel appreciated.
- Communication is terrible.
- Difficult to obtain any kind of promotion... little opportunity for growth.
- When clients are downright abusive, management is not very supportive and often lets bad clients get away with saying/doing horrible things.

pros: A fast paced work environment, with supportive co-workers and new challenges daily.  I love that there is never the same day twice, and the ability all of the techs have to be able to work as a team.  The busier it gets, the better everyone comes together.  Much improved communication between management and employees, and the different departments are working well together.
cons: Busy days are always busy days, and it can be stressful.  Emotional investment in patients can take it's toll as well, but that would be the case at any veterinary hospital.

pros:
I have been with GCVS since I was a new graduate from tech school over 15 years ago and I have grown to a Veterinary Technician Specialist and then a supervisor. I would never have had the opportunities to learn what I have learn and accomplished what I have without GCVS. 
Hurricane Harvey flooded our former building last year creating many difficulties for the company. Not once did GCVS ever consider sacrificing its employees to save money in the rebuilding efforts. Every employee was supported and their wages were covered whether they could work or not in the few months after the storm. GCVS understands that the employees are the heart of the company!
cons: When emergencies come in, it can get busy.

pros: If you like love animals and like to be around some of the smartest doctors in the city, GCVS is the place for you. People here work really hard, so you have to be committed and willing to occasionally work late hours if there is an emergency. The patients always come first!
cons: This is a hospital. Sometimes you need to stay late and go above and beyond for patients. It is expected and if you are not willing to do that, this may not be the place for you.

review_title: Caring Doctors, Bias Company, NOT Family Oriented, Poor Administrative Leadership
pros: Fast paced environment, client/patient relationship, good location, deli on site for busy long days.
cons: Cliquish environment (doctors and management), Unsupportive leadership, Lack of communication, Failure to lead by example from upper management, Expected to overachieve in current position but without having the proper advancing/training tools, Continuous animosity between both business (regrouped for image/competitor's sake), and health insurance.

review_title: Generally OK,  but going in the wrong direction.
pros: - Competent co-workers, best pay you'll find as a veterinary support staff member, good hours, generally a positive environment.
cons: - Very little room for advancement or increase in salary, poor communication between management & staff or between departments, constant IT problems, organization is becoming more corporate and money-driven with less concern for employees and client satisfaction.

job_title: Licensed Veterinary Technician in Houston, TX
pros:
I've been with GCVS for over 9 years and have no intentions of ever leaving. Opportunities to learn are limitless. You are working with the brightest minds in veterinary medicine.  
Excellent care for your own pets at a steeply discounted rate.
Good benefit package.
cons: Health insurance offered is a bit pricey, especially if you need to include your children or spouse. ($300 + with child -$600 + with child and spouse biweekly).

review_title: A great start doing what I loved and then ended tragically.
job_title: Patient Care Technician in Houston, TX
pros: You do it for the patients. The doctors and staff are great.
cons: Overworked and understaffed! Out of date equipment. No reviews or raises in some departments, Favoritism and very high turnover.

job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Houston, TX
pros: You WILL learn. You’ll never be bored. You help bring pets back from death’s door.
cons: You’ll never see a supervisor. So EC staff runs wild. Understaffed because the supervisors aren’t there to fix things.

job_title: Client Service Representative in Houston, TX
pros: Learn a lot about veterinary medicine, feels good helping people, work with animals
cons: High stress level, long hours

job_title: Veterinary Technician in Sugar Land, TX
pros: made many friends at this location everyone wanted you to grow and better your self
cons: some days required longer than normal hours but it was worth it in the long run.

pros: You will gain experience in the veterinary field no matter in what dept you work in
cons: Short breaks, Busy, not much down time but it's all worth it.

pros:
*Fast Paced, Never bored
*Learning never ends
*Pretty good pay for entry-level LVT
*Great benefits
cons:
*Negative working environment
*Not really any team-work throughout the whole hospital

pros:
many departments for your pet.
A lot of trained staff.
cons:
VERY LARGE HOSPITAL so easy to get lost.
over priced.
